AVSEC Order - 05/2015
Subject: Enforcement of access control — “Stop-list”.

In exercise of powers conferred by section SA of Aircraft Act, 1934, delegated to him
vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification no, 1797 dated 03" July 1997,
Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation) for the purpose of securing the aircraft operations in
India, directs that:

Each Airport Operator and each RDCOS, BCAS shall be responsible to maintain and
provide up-to-date “stop-list” of relevant Aerodrome Entry Permits to the concemed Chief
Aerodrome Security Officer (CASO), Aviation Security Group (ASG) who shall provide the
same to all staff at access control points including aircraft access control points at the airport,
The “stop-list” shall comprise of the details of AEPs of persons as mentioned below:

a) persons who have come to adverse notice;

b) persons who have been black listed by the Appropriate Authority;

©) persons who have lost their AEPs;

4d) persons whose AEPs have been stolen; and

©) persons who have surrendered their AEPs after their termination, superannuation,
resignation; and absconding from duty.

2. The above instructions shall be implemented with immediate effect. Any violation of the
AVSEC Order shall attract penalty under section 11A of the Aircraft Act, 1934.
